job_titles: Payments and Cash Management Product Manager - M/W
job_description:
Responsibilities
Société Générale Corporate & Investment Banking in the Netherlands (SG CIB) is a provider of innovative solutions, advisory and capital market products, serving the needs of corporations and institutions through: Investment Banking, Global Finance, Global Markets and Lyxor.
Mission:
As part of its growth strategy, Société Générale ambitions to improve its local product offering, and is seeking an experienced Payments & Cash Management (P&CM) Product Manager to join its local team.
 The primary objective of the Product Manager is to develop the local P&CM offering and ensure Société Générale is at or above market standards, thus allowing the Group to win P&CM mandates and develop NBI.
 The position is based in either in Brussels or Amsterdam with dual country coverage. Travels to Paris and other countries are to be expected.
Tasks and responsibilities:
Develop a deep understanding of the local P&CM Market
Current and prospective client priorities
Market watch: carry out regular market / competition watch on Cash Management scope to share with the local Management & the central marketing teams
In tight coordination with the central product marketing teams, develop the P&CM offering
Define a comprehensive short and medium-term country cash management product strategy including Global offering with other local GTB Business Lines when relevant (trade, factoring, cash clearing);
Identify and propose local products offer development priorities to serve the Group ambitions, based on both local and global solutions;
Participate in global projects to develop new Group solutions and run local products development projects.
Support sales efficiency
Provide P&CM expertise product support to sales teams when required for specific clients RFPs (both at local and global levels);
Promote domestic capabilities of GTB externally, inc. occasional client visits / communication to represent local product expertise and get feedback on SG Offer;
Ensure local sales teams have the required level of understanding of P&CM products and organize/deliver relevant trainings when required;
Support the central teams to share on local products specificities.
Monitor P&CM products usage and reliability
Follow key products KPIs;
Participate to local / global P&CM crisis resolution efforts when required;
Support global initiatives and report to central marketing teams
Share market information with local and global experts;
Contribute to global assessment of products that may affect local clients: e.g. pilots for new products, satisfaction review;
Report monthly on activities to the central marketing team, based on shared goals & agreed performance dashboards.
Act as Project Manager for those projects requiring internal developments where PCM must intervene locally
Profile required
Studies & experience:
Hold a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree in Finance or similar
At least 5 years previous experience with deep end-to-end understanding of Payments and Cash Management products along with a well-developed professional network in this segment
Prior project management experience
Language skills:
Fluency in Dutch (mandatory)
Strong professional level of English (mandatory)
French represents an advantage
Why join us
Société Générale Netherlands is a multi-category bank offering every employee the possibility to have several careers in a professional career path. Internal mobility and training are two core areas we focus on, in a dynamic, prosperous and evolving context.
Business insight
At Société Générale, we are convinced that people are drivers of change, and that the world of tomorrow will be shaped by all their initiatives, from the smallest to the most ambitious.
Whether you’re joining us for a period of months, years or your entire career, together we can have a positive impact on the future. Creating, daring, innovating and taking action are part of our DNA.
If you too want to be directly involved, grow in a stimulating and caring environment, feel useful on a daily basis and develop or strengthen your expertise, you will feel right at home with us!
Still hesitating?
You should know that our employees can dedicate several days per year to solidarity actions during their working hours, including sponsoring people struggling with their orientation or professional integration, participating in the financial education of young apprentices, and sharing their skills with charities. There are many ways to get involved.
We are an equal opportunities employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.
Reference: 230003RM
Entity: SG CIB
Starting date: immediate
Publication date: 2023/02/20
